description: Write a method called `count_words(text)` that returns a dictionary with word counts. Split by spaces and ignore case.
output_specification: Expected output format will be shown.
explanations: For input ['hello world hello'], output is {'hello': 2, 'world': 1}
For input ['Python is fun Python'], output is {'python': 2, 'is': 1, 'fun': 1}
For input ['one two three'], output is {'one': 1, 'two': 1, 'three': 1}
For input ['a a a'], output is {'a': 3}
notes: Implement the Hash Table - Word Count problem correctly
Consider edge cases and boundary conditions
Test your solution with various inputs
hints: Start with the base case or simple scenario
Build up to the complete solution step by step
